revised_title: Essays on Hygrometry and Barometry: Analyzing Aqueous Vapors and Atmospheric Pressure
tldr: The author presents a study on hygrometry and barometry, discussing the elasticity of aqueous vapor at different temperatures and under various circumstances. He analyzes the force of vapor at different temperatures, the "moist bulb problem," and the constitution of mixed gases. The author also examines the question of whether aqueous vapor exists in the atmosphere as a mechanical mixture or chemical solution. Lastly, he investigates methods for determining heights using barometric observations and provides related tables.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
